content.description: Technical slab with a very commiting highball movement near the top of the slab.SDS just under the overhang a few feet from the start of Goodie Bag and do a move or two to get out around the face and climb straight up to a very commiting deadpoint way up high.
Locate Goodie bag and walk climbers left ~100ft to an overhanging wall. Many have tried this project. None have sent.

Story goes that while working the first ascent a friend of Jason's showed up after donating blood with a goodie bag he'd carried out to the boulders full of treats. Then Jason sent...This is an awesome steep and powerful climb with toe hooks, bicycles, kneebars, and big poppy Arkansas deadpoints. Begin sds on a flat boulder on a pistolgrip pinch and crimp. Make a crossover move to a good crimp and then good to the undercling. Get set in the undercling and move out right (start deploying whatever tactics and techniques you may possess in your own goodie bag) to  small crimps before doing a big arkansas deadpoint (left hand) to a good pinchy pocket slot. Make it up to the big hueco and traverse left 1 more move to a jug and then transfer to the boulder behind you and drop off or chimney top out.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aaJfnl4ksMs

Probably the most badass choss pile ever. Common beta is to dyno to a chicken wing - arm bar at the very end...WTF! Begin adjacent to the start of Goodie Bag on the finishing boulder of GB. Climb up into the hand/fist/offwidth crack and keep moving left through the cave to roll out a hole into a corridor. Use both sides of the wall, kneebars, chicken wings, handstacks...whatever it take to send this thing.

Goodie bag is sort-of all out by itself and there has never been a very distinct trial. This area hosts the Strawberry test-piece namesake "Goodie Bag" along with several other classic problems and some very good looking projects.
